FK.content: machine-like spontaneity (sponta sua, what flows from the source) [event has machine-like properties?], “religion” begins again, quasi-automatically
FK.linkedContent: machine-like spontaneity (sponta sua, what flows from the source) [event has machine-like properties?], “religion” begins again, quasi-automatically

FK.content: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich
FK.linkedContent: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich

BL.content: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured
BL.linkedContent: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured

BL.content: dead father more powerful than living one
BL.linkedContent: dead father more powerful than living one

SPOM.content: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters
SPOM.linkedContent: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters

SPOM.content: figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures
SPOM.linkedContent: figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures

HASD.content: via Eckhart, like adverb quasi (quasi stella matutina), we are beside the verb that is the truth; Eckhart: “may the Father, the Verbum…help us remain adverbs of this Verbum”
HASD.linkedContent: via Eckhart, like adverb quasi (quasi stella matutina), we are beside the verb that is the truth; Eckhart: “may the Father, the Verbum…help us remain adverbs of this Verbum”

HASD.content: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment

A.content: undecidable quasi-concepts, so many aporetic places or dislocations: double bind, double band
A.linkedContent: undecidable quasi-concepts, so many aporetic places or dislocations: double bind, double band

PAS.content: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now or récit]
PAS.linkedContent: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now or récit]

OH.content: new topology re: capital, no longer linked to polis, “quasi-political”

F.content: wolf, Wolkenkratzer (skyscraper), Grateloup (scrapewolf), sounds gr, kr, skr: quasi-synonyms, quasi-homonyms w/out privileging either signifier or signified (linguistic “motivations”?)
F.linkedContent: wolf, Wolkenkratzer (skyscraper), Grateloup (scrapewolf), sounds gr, kr, skr: quasi-synonyms, quasi-homonyms w/out privileging either signifier or signified (linguistic “motivations”?)

DS.content: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]
DS.linkedContent: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]

DS.content: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]
DS.linkedContent: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]

P.content: parergon is philosophical quasi-concept if it can be transported (intact, deformed) to other fields
P.linkedContent: parergon is philosophical quasi-concept if it can be transported (intact, deformed) to other fields

P.content: beautiful this—beautiful for itself; envy, jealousy at work in our affect: because of quasi-narcissistic independence of beautiful
P.linkedContent: beautiful this—beautiful for itself; envy, jealousy at work in our affect: because of quasi-narcissistic independence of beautiful

ROP.content: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining
ROP.linkedContent: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining

ROP.content: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”
ROP.linkedContent: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”

ROP.content: quasi-transcendental (formal) law of seriality (when condition is part of the series) creates aporias not to be avoided—the very chance to think [hors-série]
ROP.linkedContent: quasi-transcendental (formal) law of seriality (when condition is part of the series) creates aporias not to be avoided—the very chance to think [hors-série]

ATIA.content: Kant, Heidegger, Lacan, Levinas, Descartes, all men, all belong to quasi-epochal category: never been seen (naked) by an animal, never imagine animal could address them > Derrida believes they all have, must decipher symptom of this disavowal

ATIA.content: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces
ATIA.linkedContent: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces

WAP.content: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)
WAP.linkedContent: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)

SW.content: waiting for a quasi-resurrection, in view of a first/last time, that has nothing to do w/ unveiling (w/ truth)
SW.linkedContent: waiting for a quasi-resurrection, in view of a first/last time, that has nothing to do w/ unveiling (w/ truth)

DPi.content: [in Genet] Christlike ascension/elevation after the gallows, quasi-ressurection
DPi.linkedContent: [in Genet] Christlike ascension/elevation after the gallows, quasi-ressurection

DPi.content: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious

DPi.content: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary
DPi.linkedContent: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary

RM.content: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such
RM.linkedContent: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such

RM.content: metaphysics as tropics, corresponds to an essential withdrawal of Being > Being, the metaphor of metaphor (quasi-metaphor), overload of a supplementary trait, fold: re-trait

TR.content: re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present
TR.linkedContent: re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present

TR.content: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality
TR.linkedContent: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality

C.content: play of supplement can go on ad infinitum, or almost [?]
C.linkedContent: play of supplement can go on ad infinitum, or almost [?]

LI.content: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once

LI.content: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept
LI.linkedContent: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept

LI.content: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?
LI.linkedContent: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?

TN.content: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”

TN.content: mouth, eyes: bordered openings, ces lieux quasiment sans lieu ——the “common” incommensurability of thought, which allows “psyche is extended,” is the “quasi permixtio” of body and soul
TN.linkedContent: mouth, eyes: bordered openings, ces lieux quasiment sans lieu ——the “common” incommensurability of thought, which allows “psyche is extended,” is the “quasi permixtio” of body and soul

TN.content: Nancy’s heart transplant, l’intrus, is not the quasi-transcendental strangeness that refers to all our “I’s,” and yet… [the 2 strangenesses keep making signs toward one another]
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s heart transplant, l’intrus, is not the quasi-transcendental strangeness that refers to all our “I’s,” and yet… [the 2 strangenesses keep making signs toward one another]

TN.content: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]
TN.linkedContent: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]

TN.content: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself
TN.linkedContent: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself

TN.content: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal
TN.linkedContent: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal

TN.content: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”
TN.linkedContent: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”

NOY.content: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity?
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity?

NOY.content: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)

NOY.content: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”
NOY.linkedContent: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”

AD.content: state, politics, ontology all betray/exceed ethics in opening it [?]: quasi-transcendental, originary, pre-originary perjury > possibility of radical perversion, haunting of its possibility, also condition of Good, Justice, Love, Faith, perfectibility
AD.linkedContent: state, politics, ontology all betray/exceed ethics in opening it [?]: quasi-transcendental, originary, pre-originary perjury > possibility of radical perversion, haunting of its possibility, also condition of Good, Justice, Love, Faith, perfectibility

BSi.content: transcategorial—“qui transcendit omne genus”: does not belong to series or table > is bêtise a transcategorial category, a quasi-transcendental?
BSi.linkedContent: transcategorial—“qui transcendit omne genus”: does not belong to series or table > is bêtise a transcategorial category, a quasi-transcendental?

BSi.content: Avital calls stupidity a quasi-concept: so unstable, subject to variability, plasticity—not secure
BSi.linkedContent: Avital calls stupidity a quasi-concept: so unstable, subject to variability, plasticity—not secure

BSi.content: Derrida stresses “quasi” because it relates to a feint or an “as if”
BSi.linkedContent: Derrida stresses “quasi” because it relates to a feint or an “as if”

SPEC.content: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP,  proper produced as autothanatography
SPEC.linkedContent: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP, proper produced as autothanatography

SPEC.content: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
